li.Students must earn a \"B\" (3.0) or high: Students must earn a "B" (3.0) or higher in ACG 3131 Intermediate Financial Accounting I to be eligible for the Accounting Minor.

courseSection0.text:
Minor Admission Requirements
Students must earn a "B" (3.0) or higher in ACG 3131 Intermediate Financial Accounting I to be eligible for the Accounting Minor.
Minor Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
None

courseSection0.text4: TAX4001 - Taxation of Business Entities and Transactions (3)

courseSection1.text1: ACG3501 - Financial Accounting for Governmental and Nonprofit Organizations (3)
courseSection1.text4: ACG4803 - Advanced Issues in Financial Accounting (3)

p.Students must earn a cumulative grade-po: Students must earn a cumulative grade-point average of 2.75 or better in all coursework used to satisfy the minor.
p.Students must earn a minimum 2.0 (C) or: Students must earn a minimum 2.0 (C) or better in each individual course used to satisfy the minor.
p.Grades below \"C\" (2.0) or \"S\" grades: Grades below "C" (2.0) or "S" grades from other institutions are not accepted.
p.Courses taken at Florida College System: Courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
p.Courses transferred must be formally eva: Courses transferred must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
p.At least nine hours used in the minor mu: At least nine hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
p.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.

li.Students must earn a cumulative grade-po: Students must earn a cumulative grade-point average of 2.75 or better in all coursework used to satisfy the minor.
li.Students must earn a minimum 2.0 (C) or: Students must earn a minimum 2.0 (C) or better in each individual course used to satisfy the minor.
li.Grades below \"C\" (2.0) or \"S\" grades: Grades below "C" (2.0) or "S" grades from other institutions are not accepted.
li.Courses taken at Florida College System: Courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses transferred must be formally eva: Courses transferred must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
li.At least nine hours used in the minor mu: At least nine hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship, Independent Study, or Direct: Internship, Independent Study, or Directed Research credit cannot be used toward the minor.

courseSection2.text:
Other Requirements
Students must earn a cumulative grade-point average of 2.75 or better in all coursework used to satisfy the minor.
Students must earn a minimum 2.0 (C) or better in each individual course used to satisfy the minor.
Grades below "C" (2.0) or "S" grades from other institutions are not accepted.
Courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses transferred must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
At least nine hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship, Independent Study, or Directed Research credit cannot be used toward the minor.
